Context/explanation:
Health IT in the US is certified to a set of criteria. The criteria are explicit and are there to protect purchasers and the people (all of us) served by the purchasers.
The most important part of this is safety.
It’s like a car: you buy a car and it has tires, headlights and other components that meet certification standards.
Health IT systems are the same. If they don’t send an Rx to the pharmacy properly - it could kill you.
Companies that falsify their certification documents can’t be trusted.
This is serious stuff.
